name: Fish-eyes and fun times
description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

key_work.title: Sony Digital Handycam DCR-VX1000
key_work.brief_description: Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 in 1995, the same year digital video launched. It wasn’t just popular for amateurs and at-home users, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking to replace the large, expensive, shoulder mounted Betacam cameras.

constellations_primary.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

start.title: The Favourite
start.creator_credit: Ceci Dempsey, Ed Guiney, Lee Magiday and Yorgos Lanthimos
start.headline_credit: Ireland, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018

video_links.name: THE FAVOURITE | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

start.brief_description: England, early 18th century. The close relationship between Queen Anne and Sarah Churchill is threatened by the arrival of Sarah’s cousin, Abigail Hill, resulting in a bitter rivalry between the two cousins to be the Queen’s favourite.

constellations_primary.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_primary.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Creating characters with Great costumes
constellations_other.description: Emma Fryer's costume design for The Great took inspiration from both accurate finery of the period, and contemporary designs of fashion houses like Dior. The resulting costumes evolve with the characters.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Dress to impress
constellations_other.description: In The Great, Peter and Catherine’s costumes during their Dacha visit are designed to demonstrate their unity, as they negotiate with the Swedish royals. Clothes have long been a way to communicate power, particularly in politics.

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

end.title: The Revenant
end.creator_credit: Alejandro González Iñárritu, Arnon Milchan, David Kanter, James W. Skotchdopole, Keith Redmon, Mary Parent, Steve Golin, M Productions and Mark L. Smith
end.headline_credit: Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan and United States of America, 2015

video_links.name: The Revenant | Official Trailer [HD] | 20th Century FOX

end.brief_description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

links.description: Both The Favourite and The Revenant contain almost no artificial lighting. Both films were lit predominantly with whatever light was already present.

start.title: The Revenant
start.creator_credit: Alejandro González Iñárritu, Arnon Milchan, David Kanter, James W. Skotchdopole, Keith Redmon, Mary Parent, Steve Golin, M Productions and Mark L. Smith
start.headline_credit: Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan and United States of America, 2015

video_links.name: The Revenant | Official Trailer [HD] | 20th Century FOX

start.brief_description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

end.title: Tekken
end.brief_description:
Seventeen of the world’s deadliest fighters, explosive martial arts moves and savage special attacks. All brought to life by super smooth animation running at a TV scorching 50 frames per second (Original description).

Tekken is the first game in the Tekken series. It was released in arcades on December 9, 1994 in Japan, and on December 11, 1994 in Europe and North America. It was then ported to the Sony PlayStation on March 31, 1995 in Japan, November 7, 1995 in Europe, and on November 8, 1995 in North America. The game was met with many positive reviews.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: Leonardo NoOscaro finally got his Oscar for The Revenant, which featured a brutal scene of his character being mauled by a bear. Tekken players could sympathise with him since the fighting game also contains a playable bear as one of its characters.

start.title: Tekken
start.brief_description:
Seventeen of the world’s deadliest fighters, explosive martial arts moves and savage special attacks. All brought to life by super smooth animation running at a TV scorching 50 frames per second (Original description).

Tekken is the first game in the Tekken series. It was released in arcades on December 9, 1994 in Japan, and on December 11, 1994 in Europe and North America. It was then ported to the Sony PlayStation on March 31, 1995 in Japan, November 7, 1995 in Europe, and on November 8, 1995 in North America. The game was met with many positive reviews.

end.title: Wake in Fright
end.creator_credit: Ron Williams, George Willoughby, Group W, Dennis Gentle and Evan Jones
end.brief_description: Wake in Fright is the story of John Grant, a bonded teacher who arrives in the rough outback mining town of Bundanyabba planning to stay overnight before catching the plane to Sydney, but as one night stretches into several he plunges headlong into his own destruction.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: The Tekken series also has a playable kangaroo. While its kangaroo is alive and well, Wake in Fright features a controversial scene of real kangaroos being shot by real hunters. Animal rights groups endorsed the scene, hoping it would inspire banning roo hunting.

start.title: Wake in Fright
start.creator_credit: Ron Williams, George Willoughby, Group W, Dennis Gentle and Evan Jones
start.brief_description: Wake in Fright is the story of John Grant, a bonded teacher who arrives in the rough outback mining town of Bundanyabba planning to stay overnight before catching the plane to Sydney, but as one night stretches into several he plunges headlong into his own destruction.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

end.title: First Blood
end.brief_description: When former Green Beret John Rambo is harassed by local law enforcement and arrested for vagrancy, the Vietnam vet snaps, runs for the hills and rat-a-tat-tats his way into the action-movie hall of fame. Hounded by a relentless sheriff, Rambo employs heavy-handed guerilla tactics to shake the cops off his tail.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: “We ain’t huntin’ him, he’s huntin’ us!” Wake in Fright director Ted Kotcheff went all-in on hunting when he directed the first film in the Rambo series, which featured Sly Stallone as a former Green Beret using guerilla tactics to outwit red necks.

links.description: The Sony DCR-VX100 was typically paired with a fish eye lens, which Yorgos Lanthimos uses throughout The Favourite frequently.
